questions.text: Where were the Disney artists traveling for inspiration?
questions.explanation:
South America.

	The movie begins with Fred Shields narrating the airplane trip of several Disney artists on their way to South America. While in South America, they drew pictures and created stories from Rio de Janeiro, Argentina, and Buenos Aires.

questions.text: The visiting traveler drawn by the Disney artists was never mentioned by name but what character represented him/her?
questions.explanation:
Donald Duck.

	Donald Duck was never mentioned by name. The narrator called him the traveler or the visitor. Donald Duck was seen in just the first part of the four part movie called "Saludos Amigos".

questions.text: What was the boat made out of that the traveler very quickly sank?
questions.explanation:
Balsam weeds.

	The narrator told the viewing audience that the traveler was going on Lake Titicaca in a balsam weed boat. Very quickly, Donald sank the boat when he pulled a balsam weed and unraveled the boat.

questions.text: Where was the traveler first seen with his binoculars?
questions.explanation:
Lake Titicaca.

	The traveler (who viewers know as Donald Duck) is seen holding binoculars and sitting on the sign for Lake Titicaca. The narrator tells the viewers that the lake is 13,000 feet above sea level. He goes on to describe the symptoms of altitude fever, all of which the traveler displays as the narrator lists them.

questions.text: When the traveler took a picture of a baby in a papoose, how did the baby react?
questions.correct: The baby took a picture of him.
options: The baby turned out to be an elderly man.
The baby's mother hit the traveler with his own camera.
questions.explanation:
The baby took a picture of him.

	When the traveler took a picture of the surrounding area, he snapped a photo of a baby in a papoose. While he was taking the picture, the baby took out a camera and took a photo of the traveler at the same time.

questions.text: The traveler watched a boy playing the pan flute to make what animal dance?
questions.explanation:
Llama.

	The traveler took the pan flute from the boy and made the llama dance. He then used the llama to go across the bridge ultimately falling from a bridge. After this, the traveler went home.

questions.text: The Disney artists left and went to Chile where they drew a picture of Pedro and his family. What was Pedro?
questions.explanation:
Plane.

	The Disney artists went to Chile where they drew Pedro, the airplane, and his family. Pedro's father delivered mail. When Pedro's father became ill, Pedro had to deliver the mail. He almost crashed several times, but got back to Chile to deliver the lonely postcard in his pouch.

questions.text: When the Disney artist went to Argentina to see the gauchos, where in America did they transplant Goofy to Argentina for the drawing?
questions.explanation:
Texas.

	The Disney artists took Goofy from Texas and placed him in the cartoon drawing in Argentina. They dressed him in a gaucho's clothing and gave him a horse.

questions.text: What bird did Goofy try to capture as a gaucho in Argentina?
questions.explanation:
Ostrich.

	Goofy tried to lasso an ostrich and ended up lassoing himself, his horse, and the ostrich. It was then that the Disney artist sent Goofy flying back home to Texas.

questions.text: Four short movies made up "Saludos Amigos". Were any of the four short movies musical?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	The last short of "Saludos Amigos" was a Brazilian musical number called "Aquarelo do Brazil (Watercolor of Brazil)". The song was performed by Aloysia Oliveira and written by Ary Barroso.
